questions.question: Which of the following is an example of free oscillations?

explanations.a: Shock absorbers are an example of damped oscillations.
explanations.b: Correct! A horizontal spring mass system is a free oscillator.
explanations.c: Over damping is a type of damped oscillation, not free oscillation.
explanations.d: An LC circuit with resistance is damped.

questions.question: In simple harmonic motion, the restoring force is proportional to:

explanations.a: In SHM, restoring force depends on displacement, not velocity.
explanations.b: Acceleration is proportional to displacement, but force itself is proportional to displacement.
explanations.c: Correct! F = -kx shows force is directly proportional to displacement.
explanations.d: Square of displacement is not relevant here.

questions.question: Which condition corresponds to critical damping?

explanations.b: Correct! Critical damping occurs when b equals 2√k m.
explanations.d: This means no damping at all.

questions.question: In a U-tube performing SHM, the time period is independent of:

answers.d: Length of liquid column in both arms

explanations.a: Time period depends on height of liquid column h.
explanations.b: Correct! T = 2π√(h/g) shows it is independent of density.
explanations.c: T depends on g, so it is not independent.
explanations.d: Length in both arms matters through h.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a type of damping?

explanations.a: Under damping is a valid damping type.
explanations.b: Over damping is a valid damping type.
explanations.c: Critical damping is a valid damping type.
explanations.d: Correct! Elastic damping is not discussed in this context.
